text: [Music]
hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with balsamic strawberry goat
cheese bruschetta that's right kinda
sweet
mostly savory but totally gorgeous and
very versatile this makes an awesome
hors d'oeuvre or first course or you
could totally serve this at the end of a
meal it's kind of a dessert so let me
show you how to make this it's almost as
easy is it as beautiful we're gonna
start with our balsamic vinegar
reduction I'm gonna put about half a cup
in a small pan I'm gonna put that on
medium-low heat we can't go with too
high of a flame here because it'll cause
problems because what we're gonna do is
we're gonna just simply reduce this by
half and if your heats too high it could
burn the vinegar around the edges of the
pan so we want to keep it just simmering
like that but basically you want to
reduce that by about 50% okay and it's
not an exact science when you think it's
about halfway down turn it off and
you're done and I shouldn't need to tell
you but I'm gonna do it anyway use real
Italian imported aged balsamic you can't
do this with some fake balsamic or some
other kind of integrate just doesn't
work alright so right there I was
thinking that looks like it's gone down
about half way I'm gonna stop and how I
know I got pretty close I poured it back
into my half cup container that I
measured the balsamic originally in and
look at that it was just about half way
up so that's perfect you're just gonna
simply set that aside and let it cool
down to room temperature and it will
thicken and it will be perfect for the
strawberry mixture all right so that's
set next onto the goat cheese and
there's not really anything to prep you
just need to take it out of the
refrigerator like an hour or so before
you want to use it we need this nice
soft and spreadable so give it a little
working over with a butter knife you
want a nice and soft like that so that's
ready next up we're gonna prep our bread
for the grill because traditionally
bruschetta is done with bread grilled
over a fire so I'm gonna use my charcoal
grill although feel free to do this
under the broiler or in the toaster
totally will work you just won't have
that little bit of smokiness that really
adds to this okay so anyway I'm using
Italian bread cut about a half inch
thick the only prep it needs is a very
light drizzle with olive oil all right
we want a little bit on both sides all
right so that's gonna give it a little
bit of flavor it's also gonna help it
brown very beautifully and that is ready
for the grill but we can't grill yet
because we still have to cut our
strawberries
fruits should be prepped before you
start cooking your bread so we're gonna
prep our strawberries by giving them a
little bit of a dice I simply cut them
in half cut a couple times that way a
couple times that way and that's it
pretty simple and yes of course you
could just slice these if you want I
just think it looks a lot nicer on the
bread if it's diced by the way I'm only
doing a small batch here the amounts
you'll see on the blog post will be for
a full batch which will make about
twelve but I'm just doing a few for
Michelle and I so I'm gonna throw the
diced strawberries in a bowl and then
I'm gonna add some freshly picked thyme
leaves and I like to just pick off the
whole leaves I like to squeeze them in
my fingertips as I drop them in the bowl
that releases those essential oils and
you really be able to smell the
fragrance of the herb all right so the
strawberries in time are prepped now we
can go out to the grill and grill our
bread and there's not much mystery
involved here you're gonna put it on the
grill you want kind of a medium low heat
so I'm using some pretty old coals they
may or may not have given most of their
energy for some grilled chicken but
there certainly was enough heat left to
do these you definitely want some
charred marks in addition to the
smokiness that little bit of bitterness
really brings out the sweetness in the
balsamic and the strawberry like I said
you don't feel like doing it on the
grill do it in a toaster do it in the
broiler but you really can't beat those
smoky charred grill marks for
traditional bruschetta I wish I could
say this cool is that Italian lady with
the giant head but I can't
by the way proportionately my head is
even bigger anyway I want you to grill
those with some kind of heat source
until they look something like that and
then we're gonna pull them off we're
gonna head inside and we're gonna do
final assembly which is pretty easy
we're gonna take that nice soft
spreadable goat cheese we're gonna
spread it on that warm smoky toasty
bread I'm so excited right now and once
your breads are spread with the goat
cheese then and only then can you do the
final strawberry step which is season
with some black pepper and a little bit
of salt just a tiny pinch and then we're
gonna drizzle over that cool balsamic
reduction
we're gonna give it a stir and as you're
stirring you're gonna be thinking that's
one of the more beautiful things I've
seen in quite a while so give that a
good mix spoon it on top of that goat
cheese
be sure to drizzle a little bit of that
extra balsamic syrup on top which is now
mingled with the juices coming from the
strawberries we're gonna finish with a
couple more time leaves we're gonna
place those on some attractive possibly
stick based serving platter and that is
a thing of beauty imagine you're having
a cookout and all your friends are over
and you walk out back with a tray of
these come on but enough about that let
me taste this just incredible creamy
tangy goat cheese smoky crisp bread that
balsamic strawberry mixture is sweet and
savory a little hint of pepper a little
hit of thyme just perfect you saw me
bite it twice right I don't do that for
just every recipe so I really really
really hope you give these a try head
over to food wishes comm for all the
ingredient amounts and more info as
usual and as always enjoy
[Music]
